title: Integrate SAM with Wrike
content:
This page describes how to configure an integration with Wrike to import license consumption and user entitlement data. This is part of the SaaS product setup in SAM.

Set up the Wrike application

  1. Log in to Wrike with your username and password. 
  2. In the upper-right corner, click the Wrike Assistant icon. 
  3. Click Apps & Integrations, and then click the API tab. This takes you to the API Apps page.
  4. In App name, enter the application name and click Create new.
  5. On the application configuration page, note down the client ID and client secret for later use. Specify the redirect URI, which can be retrieved during endpoint configuration in Service Management. See the Create an endpoint section below.

Prepare an integration user

Before setting up the integration, prepare an integration user.

Set up the Wrike integration in Service Management

To set up the Wrike integration for data import, complete the following tasks.

Create an endpoint

Create an endpoint using the Rest Executor 2.0 endpoint type:

  1. Log in to Agent Interface as the integration administrator.
  2. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Endpoints.
  3. Click Add.
  4. Select Rest Executor 2.0 as the endpoint type, enter a name for the endpoint (for example, Wrike), and then click Add. The system creates the endpoint.
  5. Click Configure and specify the following fields:

    Field

    Value
    Agent Select Agentless for a direct connection to Wrike.
    Authentication type Select OAuth 2.0.
    Protocol Select https.
    Base URL Enter https://www.wrike.com.
    Certificate type (Optional) Select X.509.
    Certificate format (Optional) Select PEM.
    Server certificate

    (Optional)

    Open the root CA certificate file of the Wrike system in a text editor, and then copy and paste the content to this field. If the content is invalid, an error occurs when you click Save in the next step.

    The certificate content must resemble the following:

    -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----

    

    -----END CERTIFICATE-----
    Enable email notification for token expiration Clear this checkbox.
    Get token configuration
    Grant Type Select Authorization Code.
    Client ID Enter the client ID obtained during the Wrike application configuration.
    Client Secret Enter the client secret obtained during the Wrike application configuration.
    Authorization URL Enter https://login.wrike.com/oauth2/authorize/v4
    Redirect URL This field is automatically fulfilled.
    Token URL Enter https://login.wrike.com/oauth2/token.
    Scope Enter wsReadOnly.amReadOnlyUser.

    State

    		 Enter state.
    Send client Id and secret Select In body.

    Content-Type

    		 Select application/x-www-form-urlencoded.
  6. Click Get token and then complete the login and consent process. If your endpoint configuration is correct, you will see the Available status in the Token status section after the process is finished.
  7. Click Save.

Create an integration

In the following steps, you'll create an integration with the predefined template.

  1. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Studio.
  2. Click New, enter the name of your integration, and then click Save. The system displays the Integration page.
  3. In the Details section, configure the integration user you created for the current Service Management system and click Active to activate the integration.
  4. In the Connector-Endpoint mappings section, click Add to add a mapping.
  5. Select Wrike as the connector, select the Wrike endpoint you created earlier, and then enter an alias for the mapping.
  6. Click Save.

Add the scenario

Perform the following steps to add a scenario to the integration:

  1. Click Add scenario.
  2. Enter a name for the scenario.
  3. In the Template field, select SAM - Import Wrike user entitlement.
     
    • Using the out-of-the-box template simplifies integration configuration compared to starting from scratch. If you choose not to use this option, you'll need to manually build your logic from a blank page.
    • You can update the APIVersion key in the template based on your business requirements.
  4. For Mode, select Asynchronous.
  5. Click Save to add the scenario. 

Next steps

Complete the remaining steps of the SaaS product configuration process:

  • Create and configure the Wrike product in SAM
  • Create license metrics (if necessary)
  • Create licenses for services included in Wrike (if necessary)
  • Verify the Wrike integration
  • Verify the details of the license models for Wrike services
  • Schedule the periodic triggering of the integration
